trans-unit.source: Represents an Application Menu that is used in a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.Ribbon"></xref> control.
Every ribbon includes an Application Menu as the first tab in the ribbon.
Other ribbon tabs contain controls for working with the document content.
In contrast, the Application Menu presents a menu of commands for working with the file.
Examples include commands that traditionally go in the File menu to create, open, save, and print files.
It is also used to access program options and the Exit command.
The following illustration shows the Application Menu for a ribbon control.
![Ribbon Application Menu](~/add/media/wpfribbon-appmenu.png "Ribbon Application Menu")

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu> can host <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem> and <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationSplitMenuItem> objects.
The Application Menu also has an *auxiliary pane* and a *footer pane* that can host additional content.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContent%2A> property hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery> and is typically used to display a list of recent documents.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContent%2A> property typically hosts buttons that enable access to program options and the Exit command.
The following list shows the typical hierarchy of elements in an Application Menu.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the content of the Application Menu auxiliary pane.
The Application Menu has an *auxiliary pane* that can host additional content.

The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContent%2A> property hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonGallery> and is typically used to display a list of recent documents.
The following illustration shows the Application Menu for a ribbon control.
The auxiliary pane hosts a list of recent documents.
![Ribbon Application Menu](~/add/media/wpfribbon-appmenu.png "Ribbon Application Menu")
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The content of the Application Menu auxiliary pane.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContent"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the content of the Application Menu auxiliary pane.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The template that is used to display the content of the Application Menu auxiliary pane.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContentTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the custom logic for selecting a <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref> that is used to display the contents of the Application Menu auxiliary pane.
You use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContentTemplate%2A> property to specify the visualization of the content.
If you have more than one template defined and want to specify logic that selects a template to use, then you use this property.
This property is ignored if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContentTemplate%2A> property is set.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A custom <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector"></xref> object that provides logic and returns a <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref>.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.AuxiliaryPaneContentTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the content of the Application Menu footer pane.
The Application Menu has a *footer pane* that can host additional content.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContent%2A> property typically hosts buttons that enable access to program options and the Exit command.
The following illustration shows the Application Menu for a ribbon control.
The footer pane hosts an **Exit** button.
![Ribbon Application Menu](~/add/media/wpfribbon-appmenu.png "Ribbon Application Menu")
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The content of the Application Menu footer pane.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContent"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the content of the Application Menu footer pane.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The template that is used to display the content of the Application Menu footer pane.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContentTemplate"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the custom logic for selecting a <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref> that is used to display the contents of the Application Menu footer pane.
You use the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContentTemplate%2A> property to specify the visualization of the content.
If you have more than one template defined and want to specify logic that selects a template to use, then you use this property.
This property is ignored if the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContentTemplate%2A> property is set.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
A custom <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DataTemplateSelector"></xref> object that provides logic and returns a <xref href="System.Windows.DataTemplate"></xref>.
The registered default is `null`.
For more information about what can influence the value, see [Dependency Property Value Precedence](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-property-value-precedence.md).
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu.FooterPaneContentTemplateSelector"></xref> dependency property.
Returns a new <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref> object.
A new menu item object that is the container for the item.
Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item is (or is eligible to be) its own container.
The item to test.

`true` if the item is a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenuItem"></xref>, a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationSplitMenuItem"></xref>, or a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonSeparator"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
Called when the KeyTip or accelerator key is pressed.
Contains data about the activation.
Builds the visual tree for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Ribbon.RibbonApplicationMenu"></xref> when a new template is applied.
This method is invoked whenever application code or an internal process, such as a rebuilding layout pass, calls the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate%2A> method.
Creates a new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.RibbonApplicationMenuAutomationPeer"></xref> object for this control.
A new automation peer object for this control.
Provides class handling for the <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewKeyDown"></xref> event.
The event data.

Returns a value that indicates whether to apply the style from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyle"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.ItemContainerStyleSelector"></xref> property to the container element of the specified item.
The container element.
The item that the container is for.
`false` if container is a , , or ; otherwise, the value returned by the base implementation.
